Confirm your enrollment  Attend an admitted student event  Connect with future classmates             Invent, Innovate and Create at the NYU Polytechnic School of Engineering As the second-oldest private engineering and technology school in the U.S., we offer a robust graduate education supported by distinguished faculty, cutting-edge facilities and a premier location in New York City. We invite you to discover why our graduate programs are the right fit for your future.                       Application Deadlines   Fall 2015 December 15, 2014   All doctoral degree programs   Fall 2015 February 15, 2015   Full-time master's degree programs   Fall 2015 May 30, 2015   Part-time master's degree programs       Application Requirements     Requirements and Checklist   Mailing Address     More     Sample Application   Transfer Credit Policy      Application Status Check the status of your submitted application. Graduate Student Profiles  Our graduate students are up to amazing things from designing robots to inventing new healing technologies to starting companies.  Learn more       Research Opportunities  Research is a major focus of our graduate programs with numerous opportunities for students to engage including research fellowships. Learn more       Part-time Graduate Study  Part-time graduate study allows working professionals to keep their career momentum while earning an advanced degree from NYU. Learn more       Online and Enterprise Learning  NYU-ePoly Online Graduate programs along with NYU Engineering's Enterprise Learning programs provide quality and flexibility for individuals and corporations.   NYU-ePoly   Enterprise Learning              Virtual Tour    Take a virtual tour of the NYU School of Engineering Explore the entire MetroTech campus and surrounding Brooklyn area at your own convenience. Take a guided tour of our labs, facilities, and academic buildings or check out our grounds through unique 360-degree images. Experience campus life through an array of videos and discover all the exciting places that make Brooklyn so unique! Michelle's New Album, "Rebellious Soul"    Watch Professor Langdon Crawford Connect Music with the Latest Interactive Technology    NY Times Reviews 'Illuminating' Collaboration with EMF       Selected Events       Summer Institute of Music Production Technology: June 29–July 10, 2015    Summer Electronic Music Institute: June 29–July 10, 2015    Girls Electronic Music Seminar    Music Technology Open House: May 17, 2014       Featured Alumni       Read about some of our graduates    Alumni in the Media              Studio Facilities    New York University’s program in Music Technology unveiled its new James L. Dolan Music Recording Studio , a 7,500 square foot multifunctional teaching, recording, and research space designed by Gensler and the Walters-Storyk Design Group. One of the most technologically advanced audio teaching facilities in the United States, the new spaces greatly enhance the 10 existing studios which house the Music Technology program. The studio is located on the sixth floor of 35 West 4th Street.       Audio Slideshow and Studio Blueprint       About the Music Technology Program    Music Technology at NYU Steinhardt is a leading and internationally recognized program in music, sound and audio technology. Students prepare for successful careers in sound engineering, computer music, audio-visual production and post-production, mastering, scoring for film and multimedia, audio for games, software development, and multimedia production.    Students study with premier faculty in New York City, the heart of the nation's new media and music industries, and join an active community of scholars, artists and engineers exploring the cutting edge of technology and music.    As part of a large and active department, the Music Technology program emphasizes the integration of musical and technical skills. Music Technology maintains a close alliance with the NYU Performance and Composition programs, encouraging collaborations that explore new relationships between experimental and traditional approaches to music. In addition, the Music Technology program offers an extensive internship program at major recording studios, new-media web-related companies, music-scoring houses and other music industry enterprises.    Students may earn a Bachelor of Music degree in Music Technology, a Master of Music degree in Music Technology, or a Doctor of Philosophy in Music Technology. Students are also encouraged to take advantage of special courses offered abroad and during the Summer .    State-of-the-art facilities include 10 fully equipped recording and computer music studios, listening rooms and research labs where over 40 Music Technology specialization courses are taught.       Dr. Kenneth J. Peacock, Ph.D. Professor of Music Director, Music Technology Program. Dr. Agnieszka Roginska , Ph.D. Assistant Professor of Music Associate Director, Music Technology Program                                   Department of Music and Performing Arts Professions - 35 W. 4th Street, Suite 1077 -  New York, NY 10012 -  212 998 5424    This site, and all its contents, are Copyright ©    by New York University.
